andComment: This anvil is keeping this box closed.
Like everything in life.
Anvils.
Anvils. Anvils.
Anvils. Anvils. Anvils.
Sometime I wonder if I'm going crazy or not.
Because... Seeing all these anvils everywhere...
That's an unrational way of going crazy.
I prefer more logic nonsenses for me, like...
Teaching good manners to unanimated things.
Like computer programmers, for example.

lines: There is a bottle on this box.

andComment: I can hear some kind of meow-meow coming from this box.
I can't say if it's coming from a cat or a zombie cat.
Well.
If it's a cat, I have to free it or it will die chocking.
But.
If that's a zombie cat, it could kill me, so...
...since I want to live, better not opening that box.
Nice corollary, Sassertal.

lines: I'm not surprised to see a brand new broom sitting here.
A broom. And since my job is getting dirty...
There is a laugh track running in my head right now.
This robot is rising its claw.
You hackers are so bad guys.
This damn machine is now asking for a password.
I have to say something aloud and I don't think that...
...statistics are going to help me twice.
Wrong password. Don't give up and try again!
But how can I say words uppercase?
Wrong password. Don't give up and try again!
Come on. I've nothing to lose.
Wrong password. Don't give up and try again!
I'm sure that I'm getting there.
Thank you for forcing our security systems.
We have to stop this Benny Dossar once for all...
Now that I found these computer controls...
I have just to input the right code.
But - surprise - non-standard keyboard here. What a joy!
Why all these exotic input systems are still around?!
Now that I found the control panel for this computer...
...I have just to learn how to use it and find the right code.
Statistically impossible and straightforward at the same time.
A computer with missing keyboard asking for a code.
A computer screen that displays a lock.
It requires to digit some kind of code to unlock it but...

andComment: The largest of the boxes in this room.
I want to see what's inside but...
...there is a large anvil on the top.
Like everything in life.

lines: You did well. Now it's your time to rest.
My first attempt with this thing failed miserably.
But I'm sure that there is the right answer around here.
Isn't this a point and click adventure?!
This opening and its computer are waiting for a code.
There is an opening on the wall and a sign over it.
The sign says 'Use this input device and insert the unlock code'.
Is this some kind of connector for a keyboard?
Well. It's pretty wide for a port!
This strangely familiar painting was hiding a control panel.
It looks like a trap. Nice apple. Nice woman.
Like, you know, in the bible...
The man in this painting looks like you!
Is... this naked girl... your girlfriend?
So... what's the meaning of this?
So why is the man so interrogative?
There is a guy with some kind of interrogative face and...
Ok. I think that time is messed up enough.
Don't look at me with those eyes.
Your only crime is that you're here in the wrong time.
A sad pirate robot and a mistake I want to forget.
The longer I look at that sheet...
...The more I want to read it.
There is some kind of certificate up there.
It's dangling under these folders and...
It looks like I can't reach that.
...but I found a screwdriver in it and that...
...makes my own adventure the most original on the market.

andComment: We can't escape from here.
It's locked by some kind of automated system.

lines: Time to face our nemesis, Pietrolastricus.
I just hope that we aren't too late.

choices: Have you got a plan for escaping?
Did you already meet our enemy?
What do you think about science?

lines: What if you're right and I'm still running in circle?
As the Duke of the Nuke said.
We'll talk about something easier next time.
Despite I'm doing my best on squeezing these two parts together...
I'll now explain how technology can help you.
How it can make your life better.
I know. You just want it.
With Broomclaw you can be different.
'for outstanding performance and best history fixing plan'
So our kidnapper should be this crazy guy.
There is something more on this certificate but...
...the writings are so small I can't see a thing.
Now we know that this Benny Dossar is going to 'fix' history...
The trick for unsticking papers without tearing them is...
Do you know what I love about getting my hands dirty...
Is there anything harder than unsticking two pieces of paper...
Now use the glue to join the two sheets of paper.
Why I have to burn this sheet?
Fire is bad. Don't play with it.
Now I should be able to read these small writings...
I can't do it again. Sorry.
You are a robot in the wrong epoch...
...and you're STILL looking at me THAT way?
That's... his eye... his eye came off...
I think that we won't escape from here easily.
Well. I think that we will be trapped here for long time...
And our evil mastermind will 'fix' the time...
I know that you trusted me from the very first time.
But I'm less than zero, now.
I'm sorry. I can't keep your gift anymore.
Do you want to destroy the entire base and die in there?!
We heard the noise from up here!
Bad scientist! Bad Adam! Bad! Bad! Bad!
Now stay put and wait for me.
I've almost finished with my evil machinations.
Imhotep? A name for a dog?
Now we've reduced the number of possibilities from 1 on 1000...
That means that our sturdy computer should be...
Thank you for attempting to unlock this computer.
The only all-in-one and easy to use operating system...
Please, say the window opening password aloud.
Wrong password. Don't give up and try again!
What if the code evaluation related to...
...how many times I try the same code over...
I'm not going to try again.
I don't know how long the right code is...
...and I don't know if putting this sticky paper into this opening...
If we assume that the glue is strong enough...
...that the code is numeric and decimal...
...there is some kind of computer vision inside this opening...
I've a chance of 1 on 1000 that this will work.
I have just to try to find it out.
Thank you for attempting to unlock this computer.
We're sorry but the code is invalid.
It didn't work. Who would've thought it?
My dear spinning friend Pietrolastricus! You're here too!
This looks like a storage room...
A jail used as storage room?
Who did stun us and bring us here?
I can see your tree from this window, Pietrolastricus, so...
We're not so far from before.
Sadly and coldly exact, mister Science.
Shut up, my 'science explains everything' archenemy.
You will be the witness and prophet of...
You're right, his laugh is truly evil.
It's obvious that he trained a lot.
I'm a little late on my evil plan schedule...
...so you have to stay here and don't die.
Since you could die of curiosity...
...and, as I said, I don't want you to die...
I will grant you just one question.
(I have to choose my question wisely.)

choices: Why do you use a jail as storage room?
How did you manage to switch off the sun?
Why are there a lot of anvils around?
How's the view from up there?

lines: I decided to add a jail to my base because it's very popular.
But true evil guys don't take prisoners.
So, as a message, I used jails as storage rooms.
Now shut up and drown in your despair!
You scientists pretend to explain everything...
Very well. Have you ever heard of INT 21?
Some holy men of Tibet discovered that...
...our life is just a simulation running on a very old computer.
That's too easy, mr. I Know Everything.
Our simulation is not truly running on an old computer.
It LOOKS like a program from a very old computer...
...but it's running on a modern one...
So I discovered that old computers had a thing called INT 21.
Using the INT 21 you can do everything you want.
That's too simple, mr. Everything Is Known By Me.
INT 21 can't do anything without the right ritual.
Then I tried to use a 2B pencil for doing it and then...
...I discovered that I was able to change the hour of the day.
Now think about how insignificant is your life.
And wait for me. Silently. Scared.
I needed a mysterious tool to leave along history...
...in order to mark the presence of God in all ages.
So I decided to use the anvil.
The anvil as a symbol of god?
'The anvil is not afraid of the hammer.'
The hammer is a tool made by technology.
The anvil represents the God, which doesn't fear any science.
Aren't anvils made by technology too?
...all these chickens with a pulley in the middle.
I think you've already got that...
I'm NOT the megaphone on the ceiling of this room...
...The view is pretty nice from here, yeah.
I can see a river and...
A brontosaurus is drinking water from there!
He is on the top of your tree.
How did you manage to discover where I am?!
Why is there a brontosaurus in Miocene?
Did someone mess up the history?
Anyway. We have to find a way out.
